intro: Isostigma sparsifolium, commonly known as the sparse-leaved isostigma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, exhibiting adaptations to conserve water. Its leaves are narrow and spaced apart, giving it the common name "sparse-leaved." The flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
